http://www.ballyalley.com/newsletters/arcadian/arcadian_vol_2/arcadian_vol_=
02_issue_09.pdfThe above link shows you how to build your own power supply =
transformer. It is relatively simple, as long as you know where the start a=
nd stop taps are.I do have one I could sell you. Because of it's rarity and=
 the cost of buying the equivalent supply, the cost is going to be $50.00 p=
lus P&H of $7.50. I could send it out as early as Jan. 3. It just plugs int=
o the main PCB, no soldering required.
If you do build your own, it is advi=
sable to either fuse each winding or put a switch on your primary winding(s=
). The )+5V bridge and lytic are ALWAYS ON regardless of the power switch o=
n the Arcade. Ask my how I know!
If you have a short in the Arcade, the pow=
er supply can get extremely hot, causing it to melt! That may be why the tr=
ansformer is not there.Do you have a voltmeter? If so, I can tell you where=
 to test the voltages to see if there are any shorts.Ken
      From: "Thoma=
s Burtell tburtell@... [ballyalley]" <ballyalley@yahoogroups.com>
 To=
: "ballyalley@yahoogroups.com" <ballyalley@yahoogroups.com> 
 Sent: Friday,=
 December 30, 2016 7:39 PM
 Subject: [ballyalley] Power supply
   
=C2=A0  =
 Hi everyone on Ballyalley. =C2=A0
I have an Astrocade from years ago that =
has a missing wall-wart. =C2=A0All I have is the wire coming out of the mac=
hine with nothing on the end. =C2=A0I'm fairly capable with electronics, bu=
t I don't yet want to desolder components inside the machine and give it th=
e necessary DC voltages. =C2=A0Option 1 is to obtain a used wall-wart. =C2=
=A0Does anyone have one they are willing to sell? =C2=A0These are fairly ol=
d, and aren't like most other wall-warts. =C2=A0They, as you know, put out =
AC at two different voltage. =C2=A0Any help or suggestions would be appreci=
ated.
TYIA.

Sent from Yahoo Mail on Android 
 
  =C2=A0   What is the addr=
ess for "the show"

"Hey Now..."
On Dec 29, 2016, at 8:13 PM, Adam Trionfo =
ballyalley@... [ballyalley] <ballyalley@yahoogroups.com> wrote:


 =
=C2=A0  I first began listening to podcasts about a year and a half ago.=C2=
=A0 Chris, my former co-host, suggested The 2600 Game by Game Podcast.=C2=
=A0 I've still not caught up on all those episodes, but I'm getting close.=
=C2=A0 One of my favorite parts of any podcast, especially Ferg's podcast, =
are the Christmas/holiday memories that people share.=C2=A0 I've heard all =
sorts of great Atari holiday-related stories, but for some reason Ferg has =
been suppressing all the stories when people "boo" the Atari and are gung h=
o for the Bally.=C2=A0 It tell ya-- it's a conspiracy.=C2=A0 (Okay, it migh=
t be all in my head!)

I'm sure that there must be some Bally Arcade/Astroc=
ade stories out there.=C2=A0 If you're one of those few people who got a Ba=
lly Arcade under the Christmas tree on Christmas Day, then I'd love to hear=
 your story.=C2=A0 Maybe the Bally was your only system.=C2=A0 Or, perhaps =
you already had an Atari and you pitted the two systems against each other.=
=C2=A0 Maybe you got a Bally Arcade very early (in January 1978) before the=
 Atari VCS was king of America's living rooms.=C2=A0 Or, maybe you got it a=
s a gift while it was on clearance in 1984 for $25.=C2=A0 Do you have a sad=
 tale to tell that involves asking for an Astrocade, but you got an Atari i=
nstead?=C2=A0 Were you were up all night crying about what might have been?=
=C2=A0 Possibly you have a four-player tale of playing 99 rounds of Checkma=
te against your parents and little sister on Christmas morning.

If your ta=
le is holiday related (Christmas, Hanukkah, or whatever you celebrate), the=
n I'd love to hear it!=C2=A0 Please write in (email the show) and tell us a=
ll about it.=C2=A0 If you're one of those awesome folks who likes to record=
 audio feedback, then that's welcome too.

The next episode of the Astrocas=
t will feature this holiday feedback in the December (okay, more like mid-J=
anuary) episode.

I can't wait to hear your tales!

Adam

=3D"none"></div><div id=3D"yiv5122176341yMail_cursorElementTracker_14831442=
40565">I have an Astrocade from years ago that has a missing wall-wart. &nb=
sp;All I have is the wire coming out of the machine with nothing on the end=
.  I'm fairly capable with electronics, but I don't yet want to desold=
er components inside the machine and give it the necessary DC voltages. &nb=
sp;Option 1 is to obtain a used wall-wart.  Does anyone have one they =
are willing to sell?  These are fairly old, and aren't like most other=
 wall-warts.  They, as you know, put out AC at two different voltage. =
 Any help or suggestions would be appreciated.</div><div id=3D"yiv5122=

br clear=3D"none">On Dec 29, 2016, at 8:13 PM, Adam Trionfo <a rel=3D"nofol=

41ygrp-text">
      
      
      <div>


</div><div dir=3D"ltr" id=3D"yiv5=
122176341divtagdefaultwrapper" style=3D"font-size:12pt;color:#000000;font-f=
amily:Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">
<div></div>
<div>I first beg=
an listening to podcasts about a year and a half ago.  Chris, my forme=
r co-host, suggested The 2600 Game by Game Podcast.  I've still not ca=
ught up on all those episodes, but I'm getting close.  One of my favor=
ite parts of any podcast, especially
 Ferg's podcast, are the Christmas/hol=
iday memories that people share.  I've heard all sorts of great Atari =
holiday-related stories, but for some reason Ferg has been suppressing all =
the stories when people "boo" the Atari and are gung ho for the Bally.&nbsp=
; It
 tell ya-- it's a conspiracy.  (Okay, it might be all in my head!=
)<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
I'm sure that there must be some B=
ally Arcade/Astrocade stories out there.  If you're one of those few p=
eople who got a Bally Arcade under the Christmas tree on Christmas Day, the=
n I'd love to hear your story.  Maybe the Bally was your only system.&=
nbsp; Or, perhaps
 you already had an Atari and you pitted the two systems =
against each other.  Maybe you got a Bally Arcade very early (in Janua=
ry 1978) before the Atari VCS was king of America's living rooms.  Or,=
 maybe you got it as a gift while it was on clearance in 1984
 for $25.&nbs=
p; Do you have a sad tale to tell that involves asking for an Astrocade, bu=
t you got an Atari instead?  Were you were up all night crying about w=
hat might have been?  Possibly you have a four-player tale of playing =
99 rounds of Checkmate against your
 parents and little sister on Christmas=
 morning.<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
If your tale is holiday re=
lated (Christmas, Hanukkah, or whatever you celebrate), then I'd love to he=
ar it!  Please write in (email the show) and tell us all about it.&nbs=
p; If you're one of those awesome folks who likes to record audio feedback,=
 then that's welcome
 too.<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
The next =
episode of the Astrocast will feature this holiday feedback in the December=
 (okay, more like mid-January) episode.<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"non=
e">
I can't wait to hear your tales!<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">=

Adam<br clear=3D"none">
</div>
<div></div>
</div>


<div></div>

    </div=
